alert.note: Alert for Estill; Jackson; Lee (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 06 at 9:48AM EDT until August 06 at 1:00PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: The National Weather Service in Jackson has extended the * Flash Flood Warning for... Southern Estill County in east central Kentucky... North Central Jackson County in southeastern Kentucky... Northwestern Lee County in southeastern Kentucky... * Until 100 PM EDT. * At 948 AM EDT, local law enforcement reported thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area with several residents cut off in the Buck Creek area. Flash flooding is ongoing. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Law enforcement reported. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Beattyville, Leighton, Evelyn, Shade, Alumbaugh, Texola, Pryse, Drip Rock, Wagersville, Doe Creek, Pinnacle, Willow Shoals, Crystal, Old Landing, Yellow Rock, Station Camp, Whynot, Blanton Flats, Jinks and Greeley. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
